text.text_translated:
PricewaterhouseCoopers is a company.  
It gives advice.  
It did a survey.  
The survey was in many countries.  
It collected more than 40 000 responses.  
Some respondents were millennials.  
Millennials were born between 1983 and 1993.  
Other respondents were older or younger.  
The survey asked about workplace culture.  
It asked about communication.  
It asked about working styles.  
It asked about pay structure.  
It asked about career development.  
It asked about work‑life balance.  

Deloitte is a company.  
It gives advice.  
It did a survey.  
The survey was in many countries.  
It collected more than 10 000 responses.  
All respondents were millennials.  
The survey asked how they see problems in work.  
It also asked how they see good things in work.

feedback.feedback:
FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.6674 is substantially below the required 0.75 threshold. This indicates a critical failure to preserve the core message of the original text. The BERTScore of 0.8404 is also below the minimum 0.90, confirming a significant loss of key factual phrasing.

- MeaningBERT Failure: The original text discusses 'perceptions of the threats and opportunities in the complex world of work'. Your version, 'how they see problems in work' and 'how they see good things in work', is an oversimplification that loses the nuance of perception and complexity. This is the primary cause of the low score.

- BERTScore Failure: Key lexical items from the original text such as 'global survey', 'participated in a study', and 'perceptions' were completely removed. This loss of fidelity to the source is unacceptable.

- CEFR Compliance Failure: The classifier rated the text B1, not the required A2. This is a direct result of using unsimplified B1 and B2 vocabulary. The words 'workplace', 'communication', 'development', and 'balance' are not A2-level terms and must be rephrased.

- Structural Failure: The text is a series of disconnected, robotic sentences. While avoiding complex structures, this fragmentation damages readability and contributes to the loss of meaning.

Suggestion: You must rephrase the text to restore the original meaning regarding 'perceptions of threats and opportunities'. Replace all B1/B2 vocabulary with A2-level explanations. For example, 'workplace culture' must become 'how people feel at work'. 'Communication' must become 'how people talk to each other'. Combine some of the repetitive sentences using 'and' to create a more natural flow.

best_attempt.text_translated:
PricewaterhouseCoopers is a big company that does research.  
It made a survey all over the world.  
More than 40,000 people answered.  
The people were born between 1983 and 1993 or were older.  
The survey asked about work place culture, talking at work, work styles, pay system, getting a better job and work and life.  

Deloitte is another big company that does research.  
It made a different survey all over the world.  
More than 10,000 young people answered.  
The survey asked how they see problems and chances in a work world that is not easy.
